linefit.FitAlgorithms

Class LinearFitStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • linefit.FitAlgorithms.LinearFitStrategy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlgorithmFactoryTemplate.AlgorithmStrategyTemplate, PartialDerivativeMinimizationFactory.PartialDerivativeMinimizationStrategy, QuadraticApproximationFactory.QuadraticApproximationStrategy

    public abstract class LinearFitStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
    The Abstract class for the Linear Fit Algorithms where the algorithm is actually implemented. This should only be created as a private class inside a factory class for the fit algorithm
    Since:
    0.98.1
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean canFixIntercept
      Whether or not this algorithm supports fixing the intercept of the fit.

      Whether or not this algorithm supports fixing the slope of the fit.

      The DataSet that this is a Fit for.

      The value of the fixed variable for this fit

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calculateChiSquared(double inSlope, double inIntercept)
      Calculates the Chi Squared(^2) value for the inputed slope and intercept with the data points retrieved from this dataset.The DataSet's Chi Squared measures the average distance of the points away from the fitted line If this function needs to be called often, then the alternate version of this function can be used as an optimization so that it is not constantly re-getting the data each time it is called
      double calculateChiSquared(double inSlope, double inIntercept, java.lang.Double[][] data)
      Calculates the Chi Squared(^2) value for the inputed slope and intercept.The DataSet's Chi Squared measures the average distance of the points away from the fitted line If this function needs to be called often, then this version of the function can be used as an optimization so that it is not constantly re-getting the data each time it is called
      (package private) double calculateIntercept(double inSlope)
      Calculates the intercept of this fit given the passed slope value with the data points retrieves from this dataset.
      (package private) double calculateIntercept(double inSlope, java.lang.Double[][] data)
      Calculates the intercept of this fit given the passed slope value and the passed data.
      protected abstract void calculateLinearFit(FitType fitTypeToUse)
      Updates the values in the Fit Algorithm's Data based on the current options and values

      Gets whether or not the intercept can be fixed in this slope

      Gets whether or not the slope can be fixed in this slope

      calculates the linear fit for only one set of errors by minimizing the Chi Squared value

      Returns the slope and its error as a string in scientific notation using ASCII characters

      Returns the slope error/uncertainty for the fit

        The error value for the slope

        The error value for the intercept

      • canFixSlope

        protected boolean canFixSlope
        Whether or not this algorithm supports fixing the slope of the fit. Set to false by default

      • canFixIntercept

        protected boolean canFixIntercept
        Whether or not this algorithm supports fixing the intercept of the fit. Set to false by default

      • whatIsFixed

        FixedVariable whatIsFixed
        What variable is fixed for this fit

      • fixedValue

        double fixedValue
        The value of the fixed variable for this fit

      • dataForFit

        protected DataSet dataForFit
        The DataSet that this is a Fit for. Allows us to keep track and not have to pass it around and stuff. Basically makes it "safer"

    • Method Detail

      • refreshFitData

        public void refreshFitData()
        Recalculates the Fit for the given DataSet - updates the fit for the given values

      • calculateLinearFit

        protected abstract void calculateLinearFit(FitType fitTypeToUse)
        Updates the values in the Fit Algorithm's Data based on the current options and values
        Parameters:
        fitTypeToUse - The fit Type to use when fitting the line

      • calculateIntercept

        double calculateIntercept(double inSlope)
        Calculates the intercept of this fit given the passed slope value with the data points retrieves from this dataset. If the intercept is fixed, it will return the fixed value. If this function needs to be called often, then the alternate version of this function can be used as an optimization so that it is not constantly re-getting the data each time it is called.
        Parameters:
        inSlope - The slope to calculate the intercept for
        Returns:
        The Intercept of the fit line if the passed slope is used for calculating it

      • calculateIntercept

        double calculateIntercept(double inSlope,
                          java.lang.Double[][] data)
        Calculates the intercept of this fit given the passed slope value and the passed data. If the intercept is fixed, it will return the fixed value. If this function needs to be called often, then this version of the function can be used as an optimization so that it is not constantly re-getting the data each time it is called
        Parameters:
        inSlope - The slope to calculate the intercept for
        data - The points data to calculate the intercept for
        Returns:
        The Intercept of the fit line if the passed slope is used for calculating it

      • getChiSquaredWeight

        public double getChiSquaredWeight(FitType fitTypeToUse,
                                  java.lang.Double xError,
                                  java.lang.Double yError)
        Gets the appropriate weight to use for Chi Squared based on the fit type
        Parameters:
        fitTypeToUse - The fit type that is being used
        xError - The x error value for the point or null if there is no x error
        yError - The y error value for the point or null if there is no y error
        Returns:
        The weight to use for calculating Chi Squared

      • calculateChiSquared

        public double calculateChiSquared(double inSlope,
                                  double inIntercept)
        Calculates the Chi Squared(^2) value for the inputed slope and intercept with the data points retrieved from this dataset.The DataSet's Chi Squared measures the average distance of the points away from the fitted line If this function needs to be called often, then the alternate version of this function can be used as an optimization so that it is not constantly re-getting the data each time it is called
        Parameters:
        inSlope - The slope to calculate the Chi Squared value for
        inIntercept - The intercept to calculate the Chi Squared value for
        Returns:
        The Chi Squared value of the fit using the passed slope and intercept

      • calculateChiSquared

        public double calculateChiSquared(double inSlope,
                                  double inIntercept,
                                  java.lang.Double[][] data)
        Calculates the Chi Squared(^2) value for the inputed slope and intercept.The DataSet's Chi Squared measures the average distance of the points away from the fitted line If this function needs to be called often, then this version of the function can be used as an optimization so that it is not constantly re-getting the data each time it is called
        Parameters:
        inSlope - The slope to calculate the Chi Squared value for
        inIntercept - The intercept to calculate the Chi Squared value for
        data - The points data to calculate the Chi Squared value for
        Returns:
        The Chi Squared value of the fit using the passed slope and intercept

      • getXOfYPoint

        public double getXOfYPoint(double yPoint)
        Gets the x value of a point that goes with the specified y value using our current fit's slope and intercept
        Parameters:
        yPoint - the y value to find the x value at on this fit
        Returns:
        The x value for the given y value for the current linear fit

      • getYOfXPoint

        public double getYOfXPoint(double xPoint)
        Gets the y value of a point that goes with the specified x value using our current fit's slope and intercept
        Parameters:
        xPoint - the x value for to find the y value at on this fit
        Returns:
        The y value for the given x value for the current linear fit

      • defaultChiSquareFitForSingleOrNoErrors

        void defaultChiSquareFitForSingleOrNoErrors(FitType fitTypeToUse)
        calculates the linear fit for only one set of errors by minimizing the Chi Squared value
        Parameters:
        fitTypeToUse - The fit type to fit the DataSet with

      • getSlopeAsString

        public java.lang.String getSlopeAsString(int resultDecPlaces,
                                         boolean useScientificNotation,
                                         boolean returnAsLaTexString)
        Returns the slope and its error as a string in scientific notation using ASCII characters
        Parameters:
        resultDecPlaces - The number of decimal places to round the slope value to. If negative values are inputed, it rounds that many digits to the left of the decimal place
        useScientificNotation - Whether or not to use scientific notation for formatting the slope String. True means the results use scientific notation
        returnAsLaTexString - Whether or not to return the String in the correct form to be displayed in LaTex (which is the incorrect form for other purposes). True returns it as a LaTex String
        Returns:
        Returns the slope of this particular fit in the format specified by the parameters

      • getInterceptAsString

        public java.lang.String getInterceptAsString(int resultDecPlaces,
                                             int yAxisPower,
                                             boolean useScientificNotation,
                                             boolean returnAsLaTexString)
        Returns the intercept and its error as a string in scientific notation using ASCII characters
        Parameters:
        resultDecPlaces - The number of decimal places to round the intercept value to. If negative values are inputed, it rounds that many digits to the left of the decimal place
        yAxisPower - The power on the Y Axis of the graph so that the intercept's power will match the power on the Y Axis if put into scientific notation
        useScientificNotation - Whether or not to use scientific notation for formatting the intercept String. True means the results use scientific notation
        returnAsLaTexString - Whether or not to return the String in the correct form to be displayed in LaTex (which is the incorrect form for other purposes). True returns it as a LaTex String
        Returns:
        Returns the intercept of this particular fit in the format specified by the parameters
